  {panel}

h5. Description

If the JIRA Base URL is set to HTTP, but an user access it via HTTPS (over a secondary connector), the avatars will be loaded using a non-secure connection. This can trigger a warning on browsers due to mixed-content being delivered.

h5. Suggestion
Force the avatars to be delivered via HTTPS when JIRA is accessed via a secure connection.

(i) This is similar to JRA-60301
fields.summary: Force avatars to be loaded via secure connection despite of Base URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63303].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When going to a user's profile on JIRA anyone can see in the activity stream the time the this user has logged on issues.
h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option to filter this activity stream and remove the logged work from it.
h3. Why this is important
Some projects may require a certain level of confidentiality when it comes to work logged on issues, user wise.
fields.summary: Ability to remove logged work from user profile activity stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63302].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Almost of time customer will follow the [Upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Upgrading+JIRA+applications] page to upgrade their JIRA instance.
However for JIRA Software 7.2.x and JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x, there is a minimum version required (7.0.0 for JIRA Software and 3.0.0 for JIRA Service Desk) in order to upgrade to the latest version. This information is currently  only available on the upgrade notes page of each application which could be easily ignored by the customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the minimum version required for JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk to the Upgrading JIRA applications page.
fields.summary: Add JIRA Software/Service Desk upgrade information in Upgrading JIRA applications page
Add field to all service desk forms with one operation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63289].
  {panel}

What happened:

I have a session open in my browser for JIRA Core 7.2.1, viewing the issues in a project, with one issue's details available. After some time I decide to view and attachment and click it.

Expected result:

Attachment displays

Actual result:

I get an error state saying JIRA can't show the attachment and I need to download it. I download it, and the download is the HTML of the JIRA login screen.

Cause:

My session has expired

Workaround:

Login and try again

Suggestion:

We should really handle this scenario more gracefully. A correct error stating you can't preview the attachment as you're no longer logged in would be better.
fields.summary: JIRA fails to preview an attachment and downloads the HTML for the login page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63285].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Using [this configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Creating+issues+and+comments+from+email#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-handytips] to allow non-JIRA users to create or comment on issues by email, JIRA only accepts the user to add comment on existing issues by adding the _Issue Key_ in the subject of the message. When trying to raise a new ticket by email, the message is rejected with the following entries in _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log_:
{noformat}Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Allow anonymous access to your project per [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project]
 # Configure your mail handler as [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Creating+issues+and+comments+from+email#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-handytips]
 # Send an email out to JIRA's mail handler

h3. Expected Behavior

The issue is created with the _default reporter_ according to the mail handler configurations
h3. Actual Behavior

No issue is created and the following entries appear in _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log_:
{noformat}Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]{noformat}
h3. Notes

This issue is not reproducible when the user is adding a new comment to an issue by specifying the Issue Key in the message's subject. That is, the message is added as a comment on the issue.

h3. *Workaround*

After some tests, I've noticed that this won't affect mail handlers that use the instance's default mail server.

So, as a workaround, you can create mail handlers that use the instance's default mail server, with a catch email address set when you need to use multiple mail handlers (to different projects).

But in some cases, it is not feasible to force all external users to send the e-mails to the Jira instance's e-mail address, and to the e-mail set as *Catch email address* CCed.

I've made this workaround to apply this without forcing the need of sending the e-mails meant to create issues to the instance's e-mail address. Instead, you will be able to use the desired mailbox as the source of the new issues, and have the e-mail routing automated by setting a forwarding rule in the mailbox that is meant to receive the e-mails that will create new issues.
In this example, I've used a *Gmail* mailbox as my source:

*1.* Create a mail handler that uses the instance's default mail server:
* Jira home -> *Jira settings* -> *System* -> *Incoming Mail*;
* Click on *Add incoming mail handler*;
* Select the *Default Cloud Mail Server* as the Server -> select *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* as the Handler -> *Next*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-11 at 10.54.58.png|thumbnail! 
* Select the target project -> the default issue type -> the mailbox where you receive the e-mails as the *Catch e-mail address* -> select a *Default reporter* (a user with permission to create issues in the target project) -> *Add*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-11 at 10.59.06.png|thumbnail! 

*2.* In Gmail, a confirmation code is sent to the e-mail address that you want to set as the forwarding target. So in this case, we will need to create a mail handler that is able to catch the e-mail with the confirmation code, and create that as an issue:
* Jira home -> *Jira settings* -> *System* -> *Incoming Mail*;
* Click on *Add incoming mail handler*;
* Select the *Default Cloud Mail Server* as the Server -> select *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* as the Handler -> *Next*;
* Select the target project -> the default issue type -> select a *Default reporter* (a user with permission to create issues in the target project) -> *Add*:
 !confirmation code mail handler.png|thumbnail! 

*3.* Configuring the forwarding in Gmail:
* Click on the cog icon -> *Settings*:
 !Gmail settings.png|thumbnail! 
* Click on the *Forwarding and POP/IMAP* tab -> *Add a forwarding address*:
 !Forwarding tab.png|thumbnail! 
* Type your instance's default mail server -> *Next*:
 !forwarding address.png|thumbnail! 
* Confirm the forwarding e-mail address -> *Proceed*:
 !confirm forwarding address.png|thumbnail! 
* The confirmation code notification will be displayed -> *OK*:
 !confirmation code sent.png|thumbnail! 
* The mail handler created in the step *2* should process the e-mail sent by Gmail, and create an issue in the target project. Here's an example of the issue created, where you can see the confirmation code:
 !confirmation code.png|thumbnail! 
* Type the confirmation code in Gmail -> *Verify*:
 !verify.png|thumbnail! 
* Check *Forward a copy of incoming mail to...* -> *Save Changes*:
 !apply.png|thumbnail! 

At this point, you can delete the mail handler created in the step *2*.

With that setup, Jira will match the *Catch email address* with the source of the forwarded e-mail (it will be present in the header of the forwarded e-mail). Jira will then process that e-mail, creating an issue with the default reporter.
fields.summary: JIRA does not create issue by email for non-JIRA users

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63281].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update 2 June 2021:}
Hi all,

I am Product Manager in the Jira Native Apps team, the team who brings you the Jira iOS, Android and Mac app for Jira Cloud. 

We have recently launched Dashboards on the iOS and Mac app! You can read more about them here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Mobile-and-Desktop-Apps/Dashboards-have-landed-in-Jira-Cloud-for-iOS-amp-macOS/ba-p/1688576]. 

For now we have supported the most used gadgets. I understand that 'most used gadgets' are not the same for everyone, so maybe for some of you here you don't see many of your gadgets in the iOS/Mac app. We have a link at the Dashboard screen for you to provide feedback on what of your missing gadgets you want to see next on the app, so do send us your request! :) 

We are looking to add this on Android next, there is no ETA I can communicate yet at the moment. But stay tune!

Thank you all for your patience and for continued use of the Jira apps!

 

Cheers,

 

Irene Ongkowidjaja
Product Manager - Jira Native Apps
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no dashboard on mobile app (iOS) as there is with the desktop version of JIRA
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a dashboard in the mobile JIRA apps
h3. Notes

Similar to JRA-62339 in that we'd like to see more issues than just recently viewed, perhaps a mobile version of the existing dashboard
fields.summary: Provide dashboard on Mobile App
Allow Organization field to be used in non SD project

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63271].
  {panel}

In a connect add-on right now there's now way to check if groups are enabled in the comment level security (there's a global setting in JIRA to control this).

AFAICT none of the many JIRA configuration/setting/application-property REST APIs return what this is set to.  

Should probably be added to https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/configuration.

It's a problem because when we render this control, we don't know if we should allow group selection, and if we do then comment creation might fail if groups are turned off in JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to check if groups are enabled in comment security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63269].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The deprecation of the Version Tab Panel as per [this documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/version-tab-panel-plugin-module] after 7.1 removes the previous capability to extend JIRA's version page with custom tabs. The [suggestion to migrate to the new web-item based approach of integrating with JIRA's new project centric view|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-general-changes#JIRA7.0-Generalchanges-deprecatedprojecttabpanels] works but greatly impacts usability. This change will now force users to move out of JIRA's native versions page to navigate to the add-ons menus to find version related functionality provided by plugins.

h3. Suggested Solution
Reconsider a way to allow plugging in add-on functionality in the relevant contexts with the new project centric navigation as well. Basically to strike a balance between the simplicity of the new project centric navigation, and the usability, functionality of the old project tab panels.

h3. Why this is important
The [suggestion to migrate to the new web-item based approach of integrating with JIRA's new project centric view|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-general-changes#JIRA7.0-Generalchanges-deprecatedprojecttabpanels] does work but greatly impacts usability. It forces users to navigate out of JIRA's native versions page to navigate to the add-ons menus to find version related functionality provided by plugins, which is not very intuitive or user friendly.
fields.summary: The deprecation of the Version Tab Panel

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we use German translation in JIRA by changing the language some of the words does not change properly but still remains in English for example

# when we run reindexing the time still shows in English *2 minutes 50 seconds*
# The final statement in which contains "Heute". This word is only then capitalized when it stands at the beginning of a sentence, after a colon, or when it stands for the present. It has to lower case here.
#  Representation of the time needs to be fixed. A correct expression of time would be, for this case: 12:40 Uhr.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the existing German translation so that there is less or no cosmetic error in future
fields.summary: Improve German Translation in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63257].
  {panel}

Plannified log scanning reports sent by mails could be usefull, but the way they are, i endend up not looking them anymore.

This is because the log rotation size is a lot bigger than my daily logs. As a result, i receive a daily mail of warnings that mostly occured some weeks ago and were already handled. But there is no indicatinon of occurence date for the warnings. I can't know if there is a new warning unless I go everyday to look for each of the warnings mentionned in the mail to check if they occured recently, or i they are just relics of the older logs!

In the support tools of the admin pages, log analyser report show the last occurence of each warning. That information would also be usefull in the mail, telling me when i need to go look for more information. But only the raw list of warnings is in the mail, with no indication of occurence dates.

Even better, (but maybe not fitted for all cases), could'nt there be an option for the plannified scanning, to remove from the mail report the warnings that occured before the N last days/scans? Or the option to logrotate atlassian-jira.log after a scan, so the  next report only show what happened since the last scan?
fields.summary: Adding date of warning occurence to plannified logs scanning mail

h3. Problem Definition
In some environments, both POP and IMAP are restricted from external access, however authentication through 'RPC over HTTP' or ActiveSync are allowed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63246].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior

Links between issues in separate JIRA instances show up in the Issue Links section even if the user viewing the issue does not have permission to view the issue in the remote JIRA instance. When two issues in the same instance are linked, the issue link will not be visible if the user does not have the ability to view the linked issue.
 * This can be seen on jira.atlassian.com. JRA-62412 is an example.
 * The ability to view remote links is currently expected behavior according to JRA-31360 

h3. Suggested Behavior

Make it so that issue links to remote JIRA issues do not show if the user does not have the ability to view the issue in the remote instance.
 * Note: A complete solution will include resolving JRA-28511 so that the link does not show in the history.
fields.summary: Hide issue links to issues in remote JIRA instances when user not able to view remote issues
Add columns to the "Issue Links" pane on jira issues

h3. Summary

Searching worklogDate with time fails.

As mentioned in the documentation below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Advanced+searching+-+fields+reference

Searching worklog date with time should work. Testing with the JQL provided in the documentation fails as well"

{{worklogDate > "2010/12/12" and worklogDate < "2010/12/12 14:00"}}


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2, 7.3


h3. Expected Results

JIRA display the workflog specific to the date and time

{quote}Date value '2010/12/12 14:00' for field 'worklogDate' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'YYYY/MM/DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.{quote}


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Searching worklogDate with time fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63236].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In my JIRA instance there are two or more custom fields with the same name. I add all of them to a certain screen and want to configure the visible fields via the Edit Issue dialog's _Configure Fields > Show Fields: Custom_ tab. There, only one entry is listed for the respective Custom Field name (e.g., there are three custom fields called 'Team' but in that drop-down I only see one entry called 'Team') which is randomly mapped to just one of the multiple Custom Fields having that name. It is thus not possible to specifically select the custom field to be shown.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud 1000.552.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have at least two custom fields with the exact same name in your JIRA instance
 # Add all of these custom fields to the edit issue screen of your project (can be any screen, basically)
 # Edit an issue using that screen
 # Try to select just one of your previously added custom fields via _Configure Fields > Show Fields: Custom_

h3. Expected Results

There is an entry for each of my custom fields and I can toggle their visibility individually
h3. Actual Results

There is only one entry for all of my custom fields which toggles the visibility of the first custom field having that name.
h3. Notes

There is a short video illustrating the problem attached to this issue
h3. Workaround

It is possible to at least show _all_ custom fields of that name by switching to _Configure Fields > Show Fields: All_; however, that is not  exactly what you want since you'd actually like to only add one specific custom field to the screen. Alternatively, you can go to the screen configuration in the admin section and hide the fields you do not want from there. This won't work for users without admin permissions, though.
fields.summary: I cannot select my custom field in the Edit Issue dialog's Show Fields tab when there's another field with the same name
Option to Skip Page Template Wizard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63232].
  {panel}

On a Time Tracking Report, selecting "Incomplete Issues Only" hides all issues without time estimates. The expectation is that this should show unresolved issues.

In looking at the Jira issues, I've found JRA-13611, which indicates this is expected. I disagree and feel this is incorrect behavior.

The Time Tracking report is supposed to be able to provide a view of work remaining on a project. There are 2 options to show issues on this report:
"All" - This results in a mess and we have to look at things that are already done or we've decided not to even do.

"Incomplete issues only" - This option seems like it should be exactly what we want in showing unresolved issues. Unfortunately it very unhelpfully hides all issues without time estimates. This makes it difficult to know how much work is left as there isn't a clean way to see which issues don't have time estimates at all.

I understand from the comments on JRA-13611 that the way this was designed was to show anything that has "Remaining time" > 0. Perhaps this is useful to someone, so alternately, please add a new filter such as "Unresolved."
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report Should have an Unresolved filter

h3. Summary
Single select custom fields will appear as "None" in the mobile view of JIRA, even thought the correct default option appears in the desktop view.

h3. Environment
* iOS
* Safari Browser
* Mobile View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a single select custom field
# Set a default option and make the field required
# Create an issue with this field
# Opening the issue in the Mobile view will show the default field value "none"

h3. Expected Results
The Mobile view should show the default value as the desktop view:
!desktopview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The custom field default will be set to "None":
 !mobileview.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
As mobile devices also support the desktop view, the current workaround is to switch to Desktop View.

h3. Problem Definition

When accessing the *Manage Add-ons* page, there's no way to easily check the expiration date for al add-on licenses that are installed on the server. For now, there will be a banner announcing if the license has expired on ir about to, but if you want to check the exact date, you need to expand the add-on information.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a way to allow admins to check the expiration date with a glance, or maybe a rest call that returns all licensed add-ons with the license expiration date.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63226].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to proceed with Project Import due to errors on Custom field options. As an example:
{quote}
The custom field 'Environment' requires option 'Staging' for the import but it does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a source instance that has a Single-select custom field with multiple contexts. (Eg. Environment)
# Set up target instance to have the same contexts and custom field options
# Perform Project Import from the XML backup
# The project import can fail in certain cases

h3. Expected Results
Every project import will go fine

h3. Actual Results
On certain project import, it can fail in certain cases. The below can be seen in the UI under custom field section:
{noformat}
The custom field 'Environment' requires option 'Staging' for the import but it does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
One of the trigger is when {{customfieldoption.customfieldconfig}} does not match {{fieldconfigscheme.id}} but the relation relies on {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}} table between {{fieldconfiguration}} and its {{fieldconfigscheme}}.

h3. Workaround
Refer to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Custom+field+values+are+not+imported+using+Project+Importers+Tool
fields.summary: Project Import blocked due to missing Custom Field Select Option values

Preeti

A backup without attachments succeeds.
 The problem is with the Attachments and an unexpected timeout from the Media API service.
 There is work already being done to improve the backup resilience to this errors and prevent this problem.
h3. Workaround

A retry of the backup with attachments may succeed as it depends on an external service load.
 Contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] to check the directory */data/jirastudio/jira/home/export* as the file is usually exported correctly to that location before the error.

h3. Summary

Regardless of the users/group set in the _Create Issue_ permission of the Project, an user with the "Modify Reporter" permission can set any user as Reporter of the case, even if that user can't create issues in the Project.
h3. Expected Behavior

The user with the "Modify Reporter" permission should be able to select only users with the "Create Issue" permission.
h3. Actual Behavior

The user with the "Modify Reporter" permission can set any user as _Reporter_ of the issue.

h3. Summary
Single Level Group By Report is not working as expected In JIRA version 7.0 anf above

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.0.0
* JIRA version 7.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Few issues with component
# Create a simple filter for the stated projects
# Go to project administration > reports > choose single level group by report
# Choose the filter that was created earlier, under statistic type choose component and click next


h3. Expected Results
The generated reports shows the component name

h3. Actual Results

!componentname.png|thumbnail!

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, we have a pre-configured event to be choose for webhook triggers. When it is triggered, it will send the same information about the changes to the target URL. While there are many options to choose, it is still not possible to set a Custom JSON body to the target URL.

If there is an option to configure a custom JSON body which will be sent out when the webhook is triggered, it will be great. Some external application could use this and there is a possibility that it does not accept the format that JIRA send out.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63193].
  {panel}

Any gadget that loads in an iframe needs a complete dependency graph for its resources to work.

Some resources require "platform" pieces of javascript – some web-resources that expose libraries or behaviours that everybody should just get, but should not have to explicitly depend upon.

Traditionally, JIRA has provided the superbatch as this "you get these things 'for free' " mechanism.

Gadgets do not include the superbatch.

This means that anything a gadget wants that's in the superbatch it will need to explicitly depend upon.

Amongst those things is an AMD loader.

Manual inclusion of an AMD loader is not scalable and shouldn't be the solution. Automatic inclusion of the loader at a platform level is the desired approach.
fields.summary: Gadgets should always provide an AMD loader

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer

h3. Problem Definition
The current export feature only includes internal issue links but not external links to other applications, such as Confluence. This is due to the fact that the export depends on the *columns* selected, which do not include external links.

This could cause issues to customers depending on several *applications* within their organization as it could lead to discrepancies.

fields.description:
*Update December 15, 2021*

Hi everyone,

I am pleased to share that we have started the work to bring dark-theme to the [Atlassian Design System|https://atlassian.design/]. This is the first step towards bringing dark mode to Jira Cloud.

Our next step will be to ready the solution for the [developer ecosystem|https://developer.atlassian.com/], so that apps can support themes too.

While the Design System work is in progress, we don’t yet have a timeline to share for bringing dark theme for Jira Cloud, that's why the status of this issue is still "Under Consideration". Rest assured that we understand how important this is, and I’ll share another update here in Q1 of the new year to keep you posted of our progress.

Meanwhile, I wish you all happy holidays!

Thanks,

Rutger

Head of Product, Atlassian UI Platform.
fields.summary: A dark theme for Jira Cloud - dark background, contrasting text, etc

h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk Customers that don't have application access to JIRA and only have the 'Restricted portal access' flag can be assigned to issues on JIRA Software projects.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud version 1000.526.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Software project
 # Create a JSD customer (with restricted portal access)
 # Create an issue on this project
 # Access the issue and click the "_Assignee_" field to edit it
 # Start typing the name of the JSD customer

h3. Expected Results

This JSD customer shouldn't be displayed as a suggestion for the assignee field since it doesn't have JIRA application access, furthermore it shouldn't be assigned the issue.
h3. Actual Results

The JSD user is presented as a suggestion for the Assignee field and can be assigned to the issue.
h3. Notes

The permission helper says the JSD customer don't have the assignable user project permission as expected, but it can be assigned to the issue either way.

This problem also happen to *Watcher* list.
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Customers can be assigned to issues

h3. Summary
The following 2 services which exist in Cloud but not in JIRA server are imported into server installation during restore from Atlassian Cloud:
* Avatar synchronization service
* Attachment MediaApi synchronization service

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Restore a cloud instance to JIRA server

h3. Expected Results
Incompatible services or jobs are removed by tasks during export from cloud or import to server.

h3. Actual Results
This incompatible services are imported into server and throw the following exception atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-11-09 19:01:41,633 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore] The class 'com.atlassian.jira.avatar.media.AvatarSynchronizationService' could not be found.  This can happen when a plugin is uninstalled or disabled
2016-11-09 19:01:41,633 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore] A NoOp Service has been returned and hence 'Avatar synchronization service' will not do anything until fixed.
2016-11-09 19:01:41,675 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore] Unable to create a service config for service with the name : Attachment MediaApi synchronization service 
com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore$ClassNotFoundServiceException: Could not find class: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.sync.AttachmentSynchronizationService
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore.instantiateServiceContainer(OfBizServiceConfigStore.java:216)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Class 'com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.sync.AttachmentSynchronizationService' not found.
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.DefaultComponentClassManager.constructEvenIfNotEnabled(DefaultComponentClassManager.java:122)
{noformat}
{noformat}
2016-11-09 21:59:00,033 Caesium-1-4 ERROR anonymous    Attachment MediaApi synchronization service [c.a.jira.service.ServiceRunner] An error occurred while trying to run service 'Attachment MediaApi synchronization service'. This method is not supported in an UnloadableJiraServiceContainer
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: This method is not supported in an UnloadableJiraServiceContainer
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.UnloadableJiraServiceContainer.run(UnloadableJiraServiceContainer.java:98)
 {noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Navigate to Services Administration page: Administration > System > Services, delete both services from there
fields.summary: Class com.atlassian.jira.avatar.media.AvatarSynchronizationService not found after import from Cloud
